Bananas are berries, but strawberries aren't.
A day on Venus is longer than a year on Venus.
Octopuses have three hearts.
Honey never spoils—it can last thousands of years.
Wombat poop is cube-shaped.
There's a species of jellyfish that can live forever.
A bolt of lightning is five times hotter than the surface of the sun.
Water can boil and freeze at the same time.
The Eiffel Tower can grow taller in the summer due to heat expansion.
Sloths can hold their breath longer than dolphins.
A single spaghetti noodle is called a 'spaghetto.'
The shortest war in history lasted 38 to 45 minutes (Anglo-Zanzibar War).
Some turtles can breathe through their butts.
Sharks existed before trees.
There's a town in Norway where the sun doesn't set for months.
The inventor of the frisbee was turned into a frisbee after he died.
A group of flamingos is called a 'flamboyance.'
Cows have best friends and can get stressed when separated.
There's a planet where it rains molten glass sideways.
Sea otters hold hands while sleeping to keep from drifting apart.
The heart of a blue whale is as heavy as a small car.
The smell of freshly-cut grass is a plant distress signal.
Apples float because they are 25% air.
A cloud can weigh as much as a million pounds.
A shrimp's heart is located in its head.
Butterflies can taste with their feet.
The dot over the letter 'i' is called a 'tittle.'
There's enough DNA in your body to stretch from the sun to Pluto and back.
Cleopatra lived closer in time to the moon landing than to the construction of the Great Pyramid.
You can hear a blue whale’s heartbeat from over 2 miles away.
